description: From pie (“magpie”) + bald (“having white patches or blazes”).

adjectives.description: piebald (comparative more piebald, superlative most piebald)

entries.meaning: (also used figuratively) Spotted or blotched, especially in black and white.

examples: Hence you will make the piebald Church more piebald than ever.

Our neighbour's fancy was for piebald horses, and so strong was it that he wished not to have any one-coloured animals in his herd, despite the fact that he bred horses for sale and that piebalds were not so popular as horses of a more normal colouring.
